DOC.brief_summary: The main purpose of the study was to evaluate the efficacy of Levonorgestrel Releasing Intrauterine devices (LNR-IUD) on genitourinary symptoms in patients with abnormal uterine bleeding. The patients were asked urogenital distress inventory (UDI) (which includes; irritative symptoms, stress symptoms, obstructive discomfort) and incontinence impact questionnaire (IIQ) (which includes; physical activity, travel, social/relationships, emotional health)questionnaires in the day of application LNR-IUD and six months later this procedure. Statistical analyse will be performed to evaluate the changes in this time period.
DOC.brief_title: Genitourinary Symptoms With Levonorgestrel Releasing Intrauterine Systems
DOC.criteria: women using levonorgestrel releasing intrauterine device for the treatment of menorrhagia or adenomyosis
